WP-Social.Net bietet - mit einem Schwerpunkt auf WordPress und sein Ã–kosystem - die MÃ¶glich zum Meinungsaustausch und zur persÃ¶nlichen Vernetzung. Wer hieran teilnehmen will, ist uns herzlich willkommen.

WP-Social.Net versteht sich als ein Teil des "Fediverse". Das bedeutet, dass ein Benutzerkonto auf WP-Social.Net das Lesen von und die Teilnahme an Diskussionen auf beliebigen anderen Fediverse-Servern, insbesondere auf anderen Mastodon-Instanzen ermÃ¶glicht, ebenso wie auch von diesen Instanzen aus auf die Inhalte auf WP-Social.Net zugegriffen und an unseren Diskussionen teilgenommen werden kann. Was genau es mit diesem "Fediverse" auf sich hat, haben wir auf der Website "Vernetzt und frei" zusammengetragen.

Die Hauptsprache auf WP-Social.Net ist deutsch. Aber auch englischsprachige BeitrÃ¤ge sind willkommen.

WP-Social.Net wird von der Praetor Verlagsgesellschaft mbH betrieben.

Kontakt   |   DatenschutzerklÃ¤rung   |   Impressum

Description:
Code of Conduct

The following guidelines are not a legal document, and final interpretation is up to the administration of kcmo.social; they are here to provide you with an insight into our content moderation policies. Moderators are authorized to take any action they see fit to protect the general community and encourage wide collaboration. If you attract the attention of a moderator here are the things you can do to demonstrate your commitment to the community, a visible history of these kinds of actions will help us decide on a course of action:

  • Listen to and respect peoples' requests to be left alone when asked
  • Politely and constructively reminding others to modify their behavior when they are being disruptive
  • De-escalating confrontational situations
  • Hiding sensitive content behind a content warning
  • Adding descriptive text to images

This instance has very much been inspired by and aims to follow the path of mastodon.social and their guidelines, which have been incorporated below:

  1. The following types of content may be removed without warning from the public timeline:
    1. Excessive advertising
    2. Uncurated news bots posting from third-party news sources
    3. Untagged nudity, pornography and sexually explicit content, including artistic depictions
    4. Untagged gore and extremely graphic violence, including artistic depictions
  2. The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline, and may result in account suspension and revocation of access to the service:
    1. Racism or advocation of racism
    2. Sexism or advocation of sexism
    3. Discrimination against gender and sexual minorities, or advocation thereof
    4. Xenophobic and/or violent nationalism
  3. The following types of content are explicitly disallowed and will result in revocation of access to the service, with or without notice, and any identifying information may be shared with the relevant authorities:
    1. Sexual depictions of children
    2. Content illegal in Germany and/or France, such as holocaust denial or Nazi symbolism
    3. Conduct promoting the ideology of National Socialism
  4. Any conduct intended to stalk or harass other users, or to impede other users from utilizing the service, or to degrade the performance of the service, or to harass other users, or to incite other users to perform any of the aforementioned actions, is also disallowed, and subject to punishment up to and including revocation of access to the service. This includes, but is not limited to, the following behaviors:
    1. Continuing to engage in conversation with a user that has specifically has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist may be considered harassment, regardless of platform-specific privacy tools employed.
    2. Aggregating, posting, and/or disseminating a person's demographic, personal, or private data without express permission (informally called doxing or dropping dox) may be considered harassment.
    3. Inciting users to engage another user in continued interaction or discussion after a user has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist (informally called brigading or dogpiling) may be considered harassment.

These provisions notwithstanding, the administration of the service reserves the right to revoke any user's access permissions, at any time, for any reason, except as limited by law.

Server Funding & Administration

This server is currently paid for and administered by @james. It is not currently soliciting donations but it may in the future. If you would like to help consider funding mastodon instead.

It is hosted on href="https://masto.host/">https://masto.host/.

Additional system administration provided by https://www.dataporters.com

Blocked content

kcmo.social may block some servers without notice.

Site Photos

Hero image is Nelson-Atkins Museum of Art | Kansas City, MO by Daniel X. O'Neil / CC BY 2.0
Instance thumbnail is Inside the Shuttlecock by Scott Robinson / CC BY 2.0

Site Emojis

The following site emojis are from Emoji M y City by Single Wing Creative:

  • :kcatkins:
  • :kcbaseball:
  • :kcfootball:
  • :kcscout:
  • :kc_soccer:
Short: Hey Kansas City, be friendly!

It may be inconsistent but always working to the goals of making space for everyone.  Read the about page or CoC for more info.'}]

It may be inconsistent but always working to the goals of making space for everyone.  Read the about page or CoC for more info.']

Description:
Basic Guidelines for Posting

  • Engage with one another in good faith
  • Respect boundaries as placed by others
  • Be respectful/apologize/give space as necessary if someone tells you that you crossed a boundary
  • Tag potentially upsetting content such as violence/blood, politics, and pornographic/NSFW material
If you are worried about a situation escalating, contact the Admins @lio or @nilsding

Rules

The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline:
  • Corporate Advertising (if you are a freelance artist, rock on and promote away, we love you!)
  • Posts that do not tag potentially upsetting content behind the CW feature, including pornographic or other NSFW material, politics, violence/assault, suicide, etc.
  • "Screenshot dunking," in which a user posts a screenshot of another post solely to criticize it
  • In addition to the tagged content above, we also ask those using a twitter crossposter to tag anything automatically posted to pounced with a "from twitter" CW or something similar.

The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline, and will result in account suspension and revocation of access to this server:

  • Racism or advocation of racism (e.g. using racist pejoratives, advocating white supremacy, etc.)
  • Sexism or advocation of sexism (e.g. using sexist pejoratives, mansplaining, etc.)
  • Discrimination against gender, romantic, and sexual minorities (e.g. using homophobic/transphobic/queerphobic pejoratives, invalidating others, intentionally ignoring or misusing another's pronouns, etc.)
  • Ableism or advocation of ableism (e.g. using ableist pejoratives, pointing out behavior as mental illness as an insult, making light of any physical or mental disabilities that a person experiences, etc.)
  • Stalking, harassment, dogpiling, and any other behavior intended to intimidate or provoke others
  • Conduct promoting Nazism, xenophobia, white supremacy and any related ideology
  • Aggregating, posting, and/or disseminating a person's demographic, personal, or private data without express permission (informally called doxxing)
  • Illegal pornographic material and any analogous illustrated material (e.g. no pornographic material involving minors, including suggestive/pornographic cub/loli/shota/etc. Art)
  • Any conduct intended to impede other users from utilizing the service, or to degrade the performance of the service, or to incite other users to perform any of the aforementioned actions

Behaviour to Avoid

  • Microaggressions (e.g. white/man/cis-splaining, intentionally using the wrong pronouns to address someone, invalidating other peoples' identities, etc.)
  • Demanding education on problematic behaviors from a non-admin/moderator. Users are welcome to educate others, but expecting it from others at all times is an unfair form of emotional labor that places the onus on the marginalized to engage at all times Presenting bad-faith arguments and otherwise concern-trolling

This is not an exhaustive list. If any of these don't make sense or you would like a deeper explanation, please speak with an Admin -- we are more than happy to help you understand the problems with these kinds of behavior.

Pursuant to the above, the administration of the service reserves the right to revoke any user's access permissions, at any time, for any reason, except as limited by law.

Emoji Attribution

This instance uses Mutant Standard emoji, which are licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International License.

Theme Attribution

This instance uses the Mastodon Modern theme, which is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 International License.

Description:
Om Fikaverse.club

  • Fikaverse.club Ã¤r en Mastodon-instans fÃ¶r talare av skandinaviska sprÃ¥k.
  • Fikaverse.club hostas av masto.host, d.v.s. av ett professionell Mastodon-webbhotell.
  • Backup av all data sker dagligen.
  • NÃ¤r nya versioner av Mastodon slÃ¤pps blir Fikaverse.club uppdaterad inom kort tid.
  • Fikaverse.club har en uppfÃ¶rekandekod (se nedan) och modereras aktivt. Bl.a. Ã¤r rasism, sexism, homofobi och transfobi strÃ¤ngt fÃ¶rbjudna.
  • Inget spam / ingen reklam.


Fikaverse.club UppfÃ¶randekod

VÃ¥rt lÃ¶fte

I syftet att fostra en Ã¶ppen och vÃ¤lkomnande miljÃ¶, avlÃ¤gger vi i egenskap av medarbetare och ansvariga ett lÃ¶fte att gÃ¶ra deltagande i vÃ¥rt projekt och samfund en upplevelse fri frÃ¥n trakasserier fÃ¶r alla, oavsett Ã¥lder, kroppsstorlek, funktionsnedsÃ¤ttning, etnicitet, kÃ¶nsidentitet och kÃ¶nsuttryck, erfarenhetsnivÃ¥, nationalitet, personligt utseende, ras, religion eller sexuell identitet och lÃ¤ggning.

VÃ¥ra standarder

Exempel pÃ¥ uppfÃ¶rande som bidrar till att skapa en positiv miljÃ¶ inkluderar:

  • AnvÃ¤ndande av vÃ¤lkomnande och inklusivt sprÃ¥k
  • Uppvisande av respekt fÃ¶r olika synpunkter och upplevelser
  • Ã–dmjukt mottagande av konstruktiv kritik
  • Fokusera pÃ¥ vad som Ã¤r bÃ¤st fÃ¶r samfundet
  • Uppvisande av empati mot andra medlemmar av samfundet

Exempel pÃ¥ oacceptabelt uppfÃ¶rande av deltagare inkluderar:

  • AnvÃ¤ndande av sexualiserat sprÃ¥k eller bildsprÃ¥k och ovÃ¤lkommen sexuell uppmÃ¤rksamhet eller nÃ¤rmanden
  • Trollande, fÃ¶rolÃ¤mpande/nedsÃ¤ttande kommentarer och personliga eller politiska angrepp
  • Offentliga eller privata trakasserier
  • Publicerande av andras privata uppgifter, sÃ¥som en fysisk eller elektronisk adress, utan explicit medgivande
  • Annat uppfÃ¶rande som rimligen skulle kunna anses vara olÃ¤mpligt i en professionell miljÃ¶

VÃ¥ra fÃ¶rpliktelser

Projektansvariga Ã¤r ansvariga fÃ¶r att klargÃ¶ra standarderna fÃ¶r acceptabelt beteende och fÃ¶rvÃ¤ntas vidta lÃ¤mpliga och rÃ¤ttvisa korrigerande Ã¥tgÃ¤rder som svar pÃ¥ alla fÃ¶rekomster av oacceptabelt uppfÃ¶rande.

Projektansvariga har rÃ¤tten och ansvaret fÃ¶r att avlÃ¤gsna, redigera eller avvisa kommentarer, fÃ¶rbindelser, kod, wiki-redigeringar, problem och andra bidrag som inte lierar sig med denna UppfÃ¶randekod eller att tillfÃ¤lligt eller permanent bannlysa en medarbetare fÃ¶r annat beteende som anses opassande, hotande, krÃ¤nkande eller skadligt.

Omfattning

Denna UppfÃ¶randekod tillÃ¤mpas bÃ¥de inom projektutrymmen och pÃ¥ allmÃ¤nna platser nÃ¤r en individ representerar projektet och dess samfund. Exempel pÃ¥ att representera ett projekt eller samfund inkluderar nyttjande av en officiell projektepostadress, publicerande via ett officiellt konto pÃ¥ sociala medier, eller agerande i egenskap av utsedd representant pÃ¥ ett online- eller offline- evenemang. Representation av ett projekt kan definieras ytterligare och klargÃ¶ras av projektansvariga.

UpprÃ¤tthÃ¥llande

Fall av krÃ¤nkande, trakasserande eller pÃ¥ annat sÃ¤tt oacceptabelt beteende kan rapporteras genom att kontakta projektgruppen pÃ¥ admin [at] fikaverse [punkt] club. Alla klagomÃ¥l kommer att granskas och undersÃ¶kas och resultera i ett svar som anses nÃ¶dvÃ¤ndig och lÃ¤mplig under omstÃ¤ndigheterna. Projektgruppen Ã¤r skyldig att upprÃ¤tthÃ¥lla sekretess med avseende pÃ¥ rapportÃ¶ren av en incident. Ytterligare uppgifter angÃ¥ende specifik upprÃ¤tthÃ¥llandepolicy kan postas separat.

Projektansvariga som inte fÃ¶ljer eller upprÃ¤tthÃ¥ller UppfÃ¶randekoden i god tro kan stÃ¤llas infÃ¶r tillfÃ¤lliga eller permanenta konsekvenser som bestÃ¤ms av andra medlemmar av projektets ledning.

Attribuering

Denna UppfÃ¶randekod Ã¤r anpassad efter Contributor Covenant, version 1.4, tillgÃ¤nglig pÃ¥ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/sv/version/1/4/code-of-conduct.html

Description: Instantzia euskaldun eta burujabea Euskal Herriko Mastodon instantzia zaharrena gara. Jalgi.eus, enpresa transnazionalek garatu eta kontrolatzen dituzten ohiko zerbitzuetatik ihes egin eta alternatiba askeak euskaraz eskeintzeko Izarkom Euskal Herriko Telekomunikazio Kooperatibak sortutako ekimena da. Ekimen honen baitan, mastodon.jalgi.eus baliabide aske eta sare banatuak erabiliaz Izarkomek #TeknologiaBurujabetza sustatzeko helburuarekin sortutako instantzia aurkezten dugu. Teknologia, Telekomunikazio eta Energia burujabetzak duten garrantziaz jabetuta, hauek elkarrekin uztartu eta gizarte burujabe baten norabidean, ondorengo baliabideak erabiltzen ditu mastodon.jalgi.eus instantziak: Zerbitzarien interneterako konexioa Izarkomen Telekomunikazio Operadoraren bidez Zerbitzarien ostatatzea Herrizoma Datu-Zentru autonomo eta banatuen bidez Zerbitzarien argindarra GoiEner Energia berriztatzaileen kooperatibaren bidez Instantziara sarbidea internetez gain, sare ireki, aske, neutral eta partekatuaren bidez ere egin daiteke.

Jalgi hadi Fedibertsora!

Description:
EFDN Rules

  • Don't be a Dick*
  • TERFs, Pedos and Nazis can into a Trebuchet
  • Dogwhistling/Apologetics for discrimination is considered the same as explicit discrimination (i.e. a ban)
  • Don't archive anything without explicit permission from everyone involved/mentioned in the posts being archived
  • Tag/CW your shit
  • Caption your Images every time you can
  • Pickle Rick posters are thrown to the kraken
  • Forbidden to Eat Teeth
  • Respect Bug Pokemon
  • Andy is the Official Pretty Boy of EFDN


* Being a Dick is defined as doing, supporting, dogwhistling.etc any one or more of the following: Racism, Sexism, Transphobia, Homophobia, Islamophobia, Classism, Ableism, Kinphobia, Pluralphobia or other forms of discrimination not listed here (i.e. this list is not exhaustive)

(And no, punching up isn't Being A Dick. Saying mean things about white people isn't Being A Dick.)

Inactivity Policy

Accounts which have not been logged into for a month or longer are eligible for suspension. At the 30 day mark, an email will be sent out asking if you wish to keep the account. If you do not reply within another 30 days, or reply that you do not wish to keep the account, the account will be suspended, to keep the user count of the server accurate. The suspension can be undone at any time, and email requests for undoing an account's suspension can be sent to admin@efdn.club or norikawa@efdn.club



Archival Policy

EFDN explicitly does not allow any archival of any user's account, posts or other data without the explicit consent of the user(s) being archived. This means that EFDN, as a whole, "opts out" to any archival, scraping or other data collection schemes, except for those users who specifically note otherwise. Essentially, if you don't see a note in someone's profile, they're opted out.

This instance is a gathering place for medievalists, amateur and professional, including academics, re-enactors (including but not limited to the SCA), as well as for those who share any of a wide variety of interests which experience has shown us tend to overlap with the above, including, but not limited to, historical, mythological, fictional, poetical, gaming, and DIY realms.

If you just want to hang out with interesting people, that's fine, too.

Try the hashtags #introduction and #HelpDesk if you do join.

Code of Conduct

While not a legal document, what follows is a guideline to acceptable behaviour and content on this instance.

This instance will not tolerate any of the following:

  • Racism, or advocacy thereof
  • Sexism, or advocacy thereof
  • Discrimination on the basis of gender, sexual orientation or, well, anything really, or advocacy thereof
  • Content illegal in Germany and/or France, including but not necessarily limited to Holocaust denial and Nazi symbolism
  • Pornography
  • Links to illegal content

Advertising

Limited advertising is permissible, especially if it is at least vaguely on-topic.

Content Warnings

The following types of posts should be put behind a content warning.

  • Spoilers for tv, movies, books, or, well, you get the idea
  • Anything NSFW
  • Most potentially traumatising content - please be sensible

Misc.

This instance is not an official channel or outlet for any particular organization or re-enactment group. That said, we have members who are active in the following:

  • Society for Creative Anachronism (SCA)
    • Atlantia
    • Drachenwald
    • East Kingdom
    • Middle Kingdom
If you are active in a group that is not listed here, contact the admins to have it added. Hopefully this list will make it easier for people who might be looking for us to find us ...

The mascot image on this site is from and courtesy of the British Library. Additional 47680, 'Pseudo-Aristotle', f.10, Alexander sending the letter to Aristotle.
Short: Medievalists and Medieval-adjacent.  Sort-of.

Description:
Code of Conduct

The following guidelines are not a legal document, and final interpretation is up to the administration of mastodon.social; they are here to provide you with an insight into our content moderation policies:

  1. The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline:
    1. Excessive advertising
    2. Uncurated news bots posting from third-party news sources
    3. Untagged nudity, pornography and sexually explicit content, including artistic depictions
    4. Untagged gore and extremely graphic violence, including artistic depictions
  2. The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline, and may result in account suspension and revocation of access to the service:
    1. Racism or advocation of racism
    2. Sexism or advocation of sexism
    3. Discrimination against gender and sexual minorities, or advocation thereof
    4. Xenophobic and/or violent nationalism
  3. The following types of content are explicitly disallowed and will result in revocation of access to the service:
    1. Sexual depictions of children
    2. Any other content which is defined as illegal in most European countries
    3. Conduct promoting any extremist ideologies, racial supremacy or religious beliefs that undermine other people rights
  4. Any conduct intended to stalk or harass other users, or to impede other users from utilizing the service, or to degrade the performance of the service, or to harass other users, or to incite other users to perform any of the aforementioned actions, is also disallowed, and subject to punishment up to and including revocation of access to the service. This includes, but is not limited to, the following behaviors:
    1. Continuing to engage in conversation with a user that has specifically has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist may be considered harassment, regardless of platform-specific privacy tools employed.
    2. Aggregating, posting, and/or disseminating a person's demographic, personal, or private data without express permission (informally called doxing or dropping dox) may be considered harassment.
    3. Inciting users to engage another user in continued interaction or discussion after a user has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist (informally called brigading or dogpiling) may be considered harassment.

These provisions notwithstanding, the administration of the service reserves the right to revoke any user's access permissions, at any time, for any reason, except as limited by law.

Site admin

Paolo Vecchi.

Server rules unashamedly Ctrl+C/Ctrl+V'd from mastodon.social rules.

Description:
Herzlich Willkommen auf Muensterland.social!

Dies ist eine öffentliche Mastodon Instanz für alle,die gerne mal ein neues soziales Netzwerk probieren wollen.Es ist absolut kostenlos und werbefrei.Diese Instanz ist hauptsächlich für Personen in der Nähe von Münster gedacht,aber es ist grundsätzlich jeder willkommen.Beachtet aber,dass der Großteil der Beiträge hier deutsch ist.Ihr könnt hier bis zu 5000 Zeichen pro Beitrag schreiben.Nicht erlaubt sind: Nazis,Bots und eindeutig illegale Inhalte.

Zu kompliziert?

Du kannst Mastodon auch mit dem Design von Twitter benutzen

Finanzierung

Ich betreibe diesen Server hobbymässig und habe nicht vor,mich privat daran zu bereichern.Den größten Teil bezahle ich aus meiner eigenen Tasche,aber da meine vielen Domains (dies ist nicht mein einziges Projekt) sowie Strom,DSL und eventuell benötigte Ersatzteile für den Server ziemlich teuer sind,freue ich mich auch über eine Spende.
Liberapay: Spenden an @nipos

Niklas Poslovski
Edelfinger Str. 46
97980 Bad Mergentheim

Description:
Welcome!

Greetings! This is a Mastodon instance dedicated to followers of Jesus Christ. Feel free to join and enjoy the fellowship of others.

If you do not receive a confirmation email within a couple days after sending an application, please contact @life or email lifenetwork@pm.me.

If Thereâ€™s Life is down, go to about.theres.life for status updates. Bookmark it now so you can find it later.

Donating

If you would like to donate to keep the Life Network running, you may do so by tipping Big_Diggity at https://ko-fi.com/thereslife

Rules

This is not a legal document, but rather a guideline of what conduct will be tolerated on this instance.

Particular cases will be judged individually, and we take all reports seriously.

Please avoid using profanity and tearing others down with your words. Remember what Paul wrote in Ephesians 4:29: â€œLet no corrupt speech proceed out of your mouth, but such as is good for building up as the need may be, that it may give grace to those who hear.â€

Harassment of any kind toward anyone for any reason is unacceptable and will result in harsh action against your account.

Speak the truth with love. Both are vital and cannot be divorced.

You won't be banned for calmly voicing your opinions, even if others think they are absurd or incorrect (no arbitrary "fact checkers"). Just be prepared for friendly discussion about it.

All in all, keep Thereâ€™s Life a family friendly place and follow Jesusâ€™ teaching in Luke 6:31: â€œAs you would like people to do to you, do exactly so to them.â€

So the rules can be summarized as, â€œBe kind to one anotherâ€ and â€œLove others as Christ has loved us.â€

For clarification, here are some concrete rules:

  • Content illegal in United States or Germany (location of the server) are not permitted
  • Donâ€™t post anything sexually suggestive or explicit
  • Any kind of bigotry against people or their beliefs is prohibited
  • Be considerate when replying to othersâ€™ posts. Would they appreciate the tone or content of your response? Think before you post.
  • Harassment is prohibited, as mentioned before.
  • Spam (repeated posting of something identical or similar) is not allowed
  • Accounts dedicated to promoting a brand or business are not allowed

Overall, keep Thereâ€™s Life family friendly.

Bots

No automated posting (without direct human supervision, such as a Twitter crossposter) is allowed on Thereâ€™s Life without prior permission from a moderator.

Reports

We take all reports from all instances seriously. We also try to respond to those who have made reports to notify them that action has taken place. When reports are sent from other instances, we will try to notify an admin of that instance to let them know what we have done to stop the problem.

Also, when there is a problem with one of our members, please discuss the issue with our admins (@life). We care about issues and want to help address them.

Questions

If anyone, including other instance admins, have any questions or need clarification about our rules or moderation policies, donâ€™t hesitate to DM @life@theres.life.
Short: A family-friendly social network (Mastodon instance) devoted to the new life found in Christ.

Description:
librepunk (adj) | \lÄ“-brÉ™pÅ­ngk\

  • something that is free (as in freedom) but queer, radical, and not necessarily technical. Created as an antithesis to oppressive software communities, and built upon the severed head of the GNU. As a concept, librepunk represents the liberation of all people from oppressive systems, from proprietary software to the gender binary, to heteronormativity, ableism, capitalism, racism, and any other machine of oppression.


librepunk (noun) | <em>lÄ“-brÉ™pÅ­ngk\

  • The ecosystem of services hosted by Puffball running 100% free and open source software without the use of CDNs, centralized hosting, or search indexing.
    see also: art.librepunk.club , music.librepunk.club (not working atm) , cloud.librepunk.club

  • A member of the online community of librepunk!

pleroma crime (noun) | <em>plÉ™Ì‡ËˆrÅmÉ™ ËˆkrÄ«m \

a general purpose bannable offense from librepunk. Pleroma crimes include (but are not limited to)
  • being a pleroma instance without allowlist federation
  • federating closely with pleroma instances without allowlist federation
  • being any type of far right
  • using slurs
  • saying irritating shit in the mentions of librepunk users or our friends
  • being a poorly moderated instance
  • posting uncensored nsfw
  • sexualizing minors
  • spamming
  • wasting librepunk resources maliciously
  • block evasion
  • crypto bullshit
  • archiving
  • scraping
  • being racist
  • being a TERF
  • and much, much more!

If you or a loved one was wrongfully convicted of committing a pleroma crime and were unjustly banished from librepunk, the official librepunk policy is to take screenshots of you bitching and laugh at them.
Short: a friendly general instance for coders, queers, and leftists!

Description:
Welcome to mograph.social

The main purpose of this server is to connect people from the broad motion design community, including VFX artist, animators (more in general designers and artists that are interested in moving images) and to contribute to the Fediverse with interesting content. It is also a place to offer to people in these fields an open space for discussion outside the toxic boxes of mainstream social media.

If you need more information about Mastodon, about what it is and how it works, have a look at fedi.tips.

Code of Conduct

In general

Be excellent to each other and respect the rules.

Keep always in mind that the aim of our server is community building and sharing of ideas and interests in respect of each others.

If you're a new member please fill in your profile with the relevant information as soon as you can so we know who we're talking to, and add a profile picture. Also it is recommended to make an #introduction post with the appropriate hashtag to tell a bit about yourself and your interests.

Crossposting

Crossposting from other networks like Twitter is allowed but if done regularly the posts should be marked as unlisted. Most importantly the account owner should be active in the conversation on our Mastodon server as well.

If you leave your account alone while crossposting it could be silenced.

Long threads

If you plan to post a long thread please post all the messages after the first one as unlisted so you don't spam the public timelines. Otherwise your account could be silenced.

Uploading videos

Due to the nature of our interests we naturally tend to share videos. While doing so please remember that the storage space on the server is not unlimited neither free. We encourage you if possible to upload your content on other platforms of your choice (YouTube, Vimeo, PeerTube, e.g.) and then post them as links here.

Image descriptions

Please add an image description for any picture or video you upload so that people on a screen reader can follow along too.

Advertising and self-promotion

Mograph.social aims at community building and not at advertising. This space is paid by the community for the community via donations and we can't accept people using it to do their free advertising campaigns. It's considered self-promotion: showcasing your art, your portfolio and skills, sharing your video tutorials, podcasts, offering/looking for work. If you're here to make a daily advertising campaign of your brand/products with the broadcasting of posts (or threads of posts) into the void, it's not going to work. Explicit advertising posts with links to direct products/services for sale will be deleted and your account might get silenced.

People, not brands, please.

Personal Pronouns

We encourage you to add your pronouns to your profile if you want them to be used and also check your folks profiles for pronouns before engaging in conversation with them.

Support mograph.social

Mograph.social is run by members of the community. Please consider becoming a patron/backer or making a donation to help us keeping the server up and running:

Become a Patron
Donate on LiberaPay
Donate on Ko-Fi
Donate on PayPal

Mastodon Server Covenant

mograph.social fully subscribes to and complies with the Mastodon Server Covenant.

Hosting Information

mograph.social is fully hosted and managed by Masto.host..
Short: mograph.social is a space for the Motion Design community. VFX artists, 3D artists, animators, designers and coders with an interest in moving images are all welcome. NO CRYPTOART / NFTs ALLOWED.

Hellsite.site is a left wing progressive and welcoming space. to keep it a space open to all where they can feel safe, we have the following guidelines for our users and moderators:

-Discrimination against those lower down on the social ladder this includes, but it not limited to: racism, homophobia, antisemitism, transphobia, classism against the working class, ableism, gate keeping of identities and general exclusionary behavior, misogyny, genocide denial, harassment, Islamophobia. We support and recognise other-kin as well as plural systems, we will not accept any questioning of their legitimacy as identities. We do endorse punching up because reverse racism and things like that aren't real

-All illegal content is not allowed on Hellsite.site whatsoever, regardless of the legitimacy of the law. Illegal content will get the server taken down, and a one person crusade is not worth that hassle. We do not endorse any illegal actions what so ever on Hellsite.site

-Hellsite.site is an anti fascist space. We endorse and support the idea of deplatforming and fighting fascism at every turn, as such we consistently de-federate with fascistic instances, and do not care who is on those instances. Because of this anti fascist stance, any and all users on Hellsite or other instances will be immediately cut off from our community if there is even any suspicion of fascistic tendencies. explicit fascist dog whistles such as the '((( )))' antisemitic echo and symbols like the frog emoji will be looked at in context, many people may be using things in a non fascist context or not understand the meaning behind something and we are always looking to understand and educate in the fight against fascism

-Hellsite.site is not an advertising platform. While fund raising and users selling their own products or sex workers advertising to get by is more than acceptable, hellsite.site is not a platform for capitalists to advertise on and park their social media brand accounts on; in the same vein we refuse to allow the platforming of any government agencies or law enforcement on our instance

-As we try to be an accepting space, we ask you do the following to be inclusive in your posting. Use the content warning system to allow for those who may find topics triggering, obvious examples include: food, sexual content, assault, mental health issues, and any other topics at your own discretion; explicitly sexual content should always be marked as such, be it text or images. second of all, we ask that people please use the image description system for all images posted, yes even large blocks of text, it's very easy for those who are able bodied to transcribe the text and descriptions of visual situations

-Consistent spam is not allowed, even when considered to be a joke by the user. while a repetition of a line here or there may be just a joke, spamming where much of the local timeline is taken up by a single user posting the same or similar variations of a word or phrase fast and continuously will be removed

-Bad faith rules lawyering in an attempt to avoid the clear and obvious progressive intent of these rules is unacceptable behavior, even when done for the sake of 'playing devil's advocate'. if you have issues with the lettering of a point here, please discuss it with the rest of the community and an open and honest criticism

-All rules on hellsite are made by the community, for the community. We are a community who built a space we want to be in, and as such all rules are subject to change by the participation of community members in talking about changing old rules or adding new ones. We welcome new ideas, new perspectives, and a discussion about what makes a space as open and positive as possible. No conversation is final, and old topics are always welcome to be brought back to the table for discussion by the community by any user who requests it

A general failure to follow these guidelines will lead to the removal of your posts, and eventually your account should we decide that the matter is serious enough
Short:
Hellsite.site: The most cursed instance on the fedi. Communism will win.

We run a custom fork of the mastodon code called Goatstodon that runs some slight improvements. 

Come for the shitposting, stay for the infinite polls and 4 gigabyte upload cap!

Description:
Welcome to Pone.Social

In general, try to keep things pony- or equine-related. Furry and anime posters will be bullied.

Porn is okay, but you may want to mark it with CW.

View all of our rules below.

Another pony Mastodon instance?

It's true, we aren't the first or the only pony related Mastodon instance. But I think you'll find our rules here are more relaxed than those other instances and are reflective of our /mlp/ roots. I think we're also the first pony Mastodon instance located in the ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸.

OK, but why pone instead of pony?

Yeah uhhh, pony was already taken so uhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh yeah.

Who's the elephant?

That's Muriel. She was a featured in the episode She Talks to Angel in Season 9 of My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic. And, you know, since Mastodon's mascot is an elephant, it seemed fitting we should also have an elephant mascot. ğŸ˜

How can I support this wonderful site?

Hey, you're way too kind. While there are costs associated with this site, it's actually not yet a super expensive server to maintain. But if you are appreciative of my efforts and would like to offset the hosting expenses, there are a variety of ways for you to do so:
  • ğŸ‘› Bitcoin
  • ğŸ’° Coinbase (other cryptocurrency options)
  • ğŸ’µ PayPal
  • ğŸ’³ Liberapay (for Pony.Tube)

I have a question not answered here, how do I contact you?

E-mail

ğŸ“§ admin@pone.social

Mail

ğŸ“­ PO Box 621622, Orlando, FL 32862-1622 USA

Telephone

â˜ï¸ +1 (844) 4TWI-FAG

Discord Server

If you want to share videos, check out our sister site, Pony.Tubeâ€”a Peertube-enabled, pony-focused video sharing site.

Omnia vincit cunnus equÃ¦ ğŸ
About Pone.Social
Short: Pone.Social is a Mastodon-enabled social network for bronies, pegasisters, and all the rest of you fellow pony degenerates.
rules: [{'id': '3', 'text': "This is a pony first instance: It's expected most users will be fans of the show My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic"}, {'id': '4', 'text': 'Expect all sorts of topics to be discussed here, not necessarily just ponies'}, {'id': '5', 'text': "This is not a safe space; you may be offended by the things you see here; we will not regulate anyone's speech (except for the next two rules)"}, {'id': '6', 'text': 'Do not spam or abuse the server'}, {'id': '7', 'text': 'Do not post illegal content (anything exploitative of real life minors, anything showing animals being abused, etc.).  Foalcon, lolicon, etc. is allowed as long as it does not represent actual people.'}, {'id': '8', 'text': 'Add CW for all visual NSFW content.  This helps maintain our federation status.'}]

Description:
Code of Conduct

In addition to the rules above. Use the norms of common decency when interacting with others. Some examples include:

GOLDEN RULE: Treat others as you would like to be treated.

  • DO NOT sling personal insults.
  • DO interact as if you are speaking to others face-to-face.
  • DO discuss topics with intelligence, nuance, and reason.
  • DO supply references for information provided when applicable.

Unpopular Opinions

We do not believe in the notion of an accepted narrative on any topic. All opinions are permitted, provided you follow the rules and conduct outlined above.
Short: A general social gathering space to discuss a wide range of topics and thoughts.

Description:
The Church of Cathode

Cathode Church is a Mastodon instance on the Fediverse for trans and gender-diverse makers, coders and tinkerers.

It is intended to be a supportive, friendly, and creative online space.

Tenets

Courtesy

Harassment, vitriol, exploitation and abuse are not tolerated. This includes racism, sexism, homophobia, transphobia, ableism and other expressions of power across structural power/privilege differentials.

Respect and venerate the great constellation of human experience and self-expression, across gender, sexuality, neurology, psychology, body, ability, race, identity, culture, spirituality, et cetera.

Content warnings should be used in accordance with evolving community standards and the needs of fellow users.

Accounts posting content not suitable for minors such as pornography or explicit sexual content should be locked and clearly marked as 18+ only in the display name or bio. The account-holder must reject follow requests from users who do not make clear that they are over 18. All posts containing explicit material must also be content-warned as such and have media hidden.

Bot accounts are allowed, but must not interact with other users without their consent.

Copyrighted content should not be posted without permission, and always with credit, ideally hyperlinking to the author's online presence.

Solidarity

Church users are expected to work to educate themselves and support their fellows with different lived experiences, cultures, beliefs, and intersections of structural power. It is not the responsibility of those whose identity or experience you do not understand to explain themselves to those yet uninformed. Any education offered is given as a favour and should be respected as such.

No one person can champion all worthy causes, and bigotry cannot be fought on any single front. Respect the work of those who are dedicated to different parts of the fight. Respect the capacity of others.

Irradiate the Rich

As part of our Solidarity, always remember who the greater persecutor is, who is responsible for the ignorance of our peers, and oppression of our communities. Disagreements among us are important and natural but can obscure the greater perspective.

Intersectionality

Solidarity is meaningless without acknowledging and actively working against the multitudinous gradients of privilege/power any of us may hold over others. Consider your privileges and their ramifications when engaging with other users.

Privacy

Church users are not required or expected to disclose or externally verify any aspects of their identity or to administrators other than a functioning email for signup, excluding conditions agreed to during the sign-up process.

Creating or using alternate accounts to evade blocks, mutings, suspensions or silencings is not allowed by any users.

Advocacy

Instances with a history of permitting harassment, abusive behaviour, and spam by their users will be blocked, regardless of the wording of their policies.

Church administrators will stand behind users reporting harassment and personally follow up where necessary and wanted, maintaining the anonymity of our users where possible, including against other church users.

Moderating disputes

Where a church user is under investigation for violating the Tenets, they will be informed of such as soon as practical, and offered the right of defence through a moderator. No public announcements will be made until a final decision is settled, and only if the decision affects other parties (such as in the case of an outright ban of a serial harasser).

Both those accused and those reporting are requested to avoid non-conciliatory public interaction with each other, 'callouts', and the like, until moderating decisions have been made.

Ephemerality

The highest priority of Cathode Church is maintaining the safety of our users and this can contradict some assumptions of federating software regarding open access. The server is configured to disable search indexing and unauthenticated viewing of the timeline or toots where possible. Known fulltext-indexers are blocked. Hosts detected attempting to scan/crawl media files will be blocked.

That said, it is not recommended to rely on the security of Mastodon for very private information.

Conclusion

To be considered for an account, you must confirm that you have read and understood these responsibilities and expectations, by mentioning the Tenets in the "Why do you want to join?" field. If you do not, your account will not be activated.

If you have any issues, email s0 at this domain.

Administrative details

Technical

Cathode Church is run off a VPS in Sydney, Australia, and uses OpenStack Object Storage also in Sydney for media storage. The site should be fully accessible via IPv6 and modern HTTPS/TLS.

Multiple Sessions

Inspired by vulpine.club's setup, it is possible to maintain multiple separate sessions for separate accounts by using the subdomains 0.cathode.church, 1.cathode.church, 2.cathode.church, and 3.cathode.church.

Local-only Posting

Toots that end with ğŸ‘ or have "Local-only" enabled in the web interface are not federated from cathode.church to any other instance. They are only visible to Cathode Church users (depending on the toot visibility setting).

Donating

You can donate to the server's upkeep at s0's Ko-fi. It will be appreciated.

Art & Emoji

The background image of the Cathode skin under Glitch Edition flavour is by the Weld, and All Rights Reserved.

This instance uses hand-picked subsets of the following emoji sets:

  • Mutant Standard emoji, which are licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International License.
  • Robomoji, a modified subset of the Mutant Standard emoji, which are also provided under the Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International License.
  • Blob Emoji, which are licensed under the Apache License 2.0.
  • Meowmoji, a modified subset of Blob Emoji, which are also licensed under the Apache License 2.0.
  • Blobhaj emoji, by heatherhorns, licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License.
  • Dragn emoji, by @chr@cybre.space, licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License.

Guilds

UTVI

Cathode Church is a member of the Union of Typeslut Verified Instances. Freeze peach nerds stay mad.
Short: A place for trans makers, coders, tinkerers and dreamers.

Description:
Welcome to the Dragon's Cave!

The Dragon's cave is a small dragon-themed community of mostly visually impaired folks. Everyone is welcome, however, as long as they are a kind and friendly person. You can expect posts about accessibility, development, gaming, privacy, and other technology related topics, but also food, music, poetry, short stories, and other things of interest.

Are you curious about why you should join this instance over all the others out there? Here are some of the things we offer:

  • A cool domain name (at least if you like dragons, but who doesn't?)
  • Roars, rather than posts, to fit the draconic theme.
  • A small and pleasant local community â€” with an option of local-only posting if you're feeling shy â€” as well as plenty of friends awaiting you in the vast Fediverse outside of it.
  • Four mostly-benevolent staff members who regularly check and respond to reports, questions, and requests.
  • A larger character limit, 3000 instead of 500, so you will always have enough space to express your opinions clearly.
  • A few useful features added by the Mastodon fork Glitch, such as the aforementioned local-only posting and bigger character limit and better formatting of posts from other software in the Fediverse.
  • A small collection of custom emojis, which we'll gladly expand upon request.

If this has convinced you, please familiarize yourself with our etiquette and then send us an application! Since we receive a large volume of spam signups, we would appreciate if you told us a little about yourself and why you wish to join. Remember to include the confirmation password that proves you have read the rules, which you can find below them.

The Dragon's Cave Etiquette

We want this instance to be a welcoming and comfortable space -- idealy for everyone, but most of all for those who are marginalised and cannot as easily find one elsewhere. To achieve this, keep the following five rules in mind. As it would be impossible to include everything, consider them a basic moral framework, which the administrators will use to act upon each individual issue in good faith. However, if you already have the urge to test the limits of these rules, or disagree with some or all of them, this instance is not for you.

1. Be Decent

Do not harass, insult, or otherwise intentionally harm other users of any kind, local or federated. Do not discriminate against people based on any of the various things that make humanity so beautiful and diverse, including but not limited to: age, appearance, body shape and size, disability, ethnicity, gender, nationality, race, religion or lack thereof, sexual orientation, etc.

This instance is not the place to debate the existence of so-called reverse racism, or to respond to systemic critiques with the "not all X" defense.

Do not deliberately spread misinformation, including pseudoscience and conspiracy theories. Given the dangers of the current situation we find ourselves in, COVID-19 related misinformation will be dealt with especially strictly; do not post or boost any misinformation minimizing the virus's impact, accusing the medical community or affected people of lying, or discouraging social distancing, vaccinations, and the wearing of masks.

2. Be Sentient

Avoid creating advertising or bot accounts on this instance without permission. There may be exceptions, but it is best to consult with the administrators before going ahead. Please consider instead joining one of the specialized instances for bot accounts, which are a better place for your account's visibility and discoverability, as well as the health of our instance's timelines and federation.

3. Be Active

Cross posting (using software to post the same content on multiple social media services) is only allowed if you regularly check your account here and interact with notifications. Please set cross posts to Unlisted or stricter. Do not crosspost content from other people, such as retweets, unless you have their consent to share it on other platforms.

4. Be Lawful

Do not post or link to content that could get us hit with a violation of copyright. Only post personally identifiable information if you have explicit permission to do so. In general, if you are not sure whether or not to share something, it is likely you should not. Keep in mind that this instance is hosted in Germany and thus abides by its laws.

Please post any sexual content as Unlisted or stricter, and make sure to add an appropriate content warning. If you regularly find yourself wanting to post content of sexual nature, this may not be the best instance for you. Do not post any sexualized depictions of animals, minors, or sexual assault, regardless of whether they are real or fictional.

5. Be Mindful

Politics, Religion, and other controversial topics should be posted behind a content warning. Be mindful of people you interact with, as they may have had experiences drastically different from yours, including severe psychological or physical trauma. Content warnings are no inconvenience for you as a user, and will provide a much higher well being for individuals that might want to read your content, but prefer not to get involved in those topics due to various reasons.

What SHOULD contain a CW?: AI content, alcohol or drugs (especially when talking about extreme entoxication or disparaging sobriety), anything of a sexual nature (this should also be Unlisted or stricter), covid-19, physical and mental health, recounting violent or alarming encounters, religion, trauma, war.

Things that are considerate to CW: Eye contact (For images), food, family, long threads, talking about other social media, trending topics, unusual things for you to post about.

Please try to describe your media posts to the best of your ability to accommodate disabilities such as blindness and deafness. If you cannot do so, there is nothing wrong with asking for help. Currently, tagging @ImageCaptionsPls@a.gup.pe is the best way to do so.

The Confirmation Password

You have reached the end of our etiquette. Thank you for your diligence! The password you should add to your application is: confelicity. We chose it because it is a sadly uncommon word, meaning "pleasure in another's happiness."

Instance Administration

Dragon's Cave is currently moderated by four people: Talon, Mayana, Fireborn and Quin. We do our best to take care of the instance, but we are just volunteers, and only human. If you come upon any objectionable content, please report it, and we will respond as soon as possible. Additionally, feel free to reach out to us if you would like us to change something about the rules above, the instance moderation actions below, or anything else related to the instance.

If possible, please mention the administration account and not our personal accounts.

Donations

This server is run by volunteers. If you'd like to help keep it running, feel free to donate on Ko-Fi

We are currently looking into setting up a recurring donation service. Once we have one, it will show up here.

Operating costs

Here is a list of all the monthly and yearly expenses to run the Dragon's Cave.

  • Server: 42 euro/month
  • Email: 36 euro/month
  • Media storage: about 5 to 6 euro/month
  • Domain: about 17-18 euro/year
  • Total: About 85 euros and 30 cents/month

These costs are subject to change depending on the scale of the instance.

Emoji Credits And Descriptions

Most of the custom emoji on this instance are from Mutant Standard, and are licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International License. All the Mutant Standard emoji are gender-neutral.

Some of the dragon emoji were drawn by Chr@scalie.business and are provided under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International License. They are cute, sweet minimalist flat style emojis of yellow, western-styled dragon heads. You can read the descriptions of individual emojis on Chr's Github.

The rest of the dragon emoji are from Volpeon and can be found here.

The eyeless smileys -- descriptions here -- were kindly gifted by LJWrites@rage.love. The eyeless blobcats were made by Pixouls@post.lurk.org; they can be downloaded on their Github.

The calculator dragon emoji's were done by @StoryDragon.

Lastly, the interaction permit/refusal emoji (at, boost and favorite OK and no), as well as the local_only emoji, which makes it possible to post locally even on clients that otherwise don't support it, were made by Pfx.rage.love. You can find their descriptions in these toots.

Impressum - Kontakt zu den Verantwortlichen

Betreiber des Dienstes

Spenden

Olaf John

HauptstraÃŸe 8

63762 GroÃŸostheim

Mastodon: @olaf@mastodon.bachgau.social

E-Mail: mail@bachgau.social

Backup-Administrator

Tine Siefken

Mastodon: @tine@mastodon.bachgau.social

Motivation

Wir mÃ¶chten eine datenschutzfreundliche Alternative zu den gÃ¤ngigen kommerziellen Diensten anbieten.

Dieser Server steht im Bachgau, einer Region im bayrischen Untermain, zwischen Aschaffenburg und Frankfurt.

Wir mÃ¶chten alle Menschen, Vereinen und Institutionen sowie BehÃ¶rden, aus dem Bachgau, dem Stadt und Landkreis Aschaffenburg und darÃ¼ber hinaus einladen, ein Teil unserer Gemeinschaft zu werden. Wir bieten eine schnelle und offene Kommunikationsplattform im Fediverse, abseits der kommerziellen Datenkraken. So wie unserer Knoten ist das ganze Fediverse werbefrei, frei von Tracking und respektiert Eure PrivatsphÃ¤re.

Einstellen des Dienstes

Wir investieren Zeit in unserer Freizeit und Geld, um den Server in Betrieb zu halten.

Daher ist es nicht ausgeschlossen, dass wir den Betrieb eventuell irgendwann einstellen.

Allerdings unterrichten wir 3 Monate vor Einstellung des Dienstes alle Benutzer, damit diese ihre Daten sichern kÃ¶nnen und ggf. auf einen anderen Server umziehen kÃ¶nnen.

Technische Details

Diese Instanz von Mastodon bietet die folgenden technischen Features:

  • RegelmÃ¤ÃŸige, automatische und verschlÃ¼sselte Backups
  • Automatische Sicherheitsupdates
  • Standort der Server ist Deutschland, Landkreis Aschaffenburg, Bachgau

Teilnahme an Relais

Alle Nachrichten (Toots), die Ã¶ffentlich markiert sind und auf der lokalen Zeitleiste erscheinen, werden zusÃ¤tzlich an ein Relais Ã¼bergeben und somit in den lokalen Zeitleisten auf teilnehmenden Instanzen eingeblendet.

UnterstÃ¼tzung

Gerne kannst du uns unterstÃ¼tzen, das geht zum einen Ã¼ber freiwillige Mitarbeit (Server Wartung, Moderation, Hilfestellung)

Spenden

Kaffeespender

Description:
MANIFESTO DI PUNTARELLA.PARTY

COSA

Puntarella.party Ã¨ un social network indipendente, libero da logiche di profitto, non regolato da nessun algoritmo, antifascista, antirazzista e antisessista, basato a Roma. PiÃ¹ precisamente Ã¨ un nodo (istanza) di una rete di centinaia di altri server indipendenti in tutto il mondo (Fediverso) e che adotta un software di microblogging (che vuol dire?): Mastodon. Come funziona Mastodon? C'Ã¨ un'ottima guida su mastodon.help. C'Ã¨ da aggiungere solo che da noi un post (toot) puÃ² essere lungo fino a 840 caratteri.

CHI

Il collettivo di gestione di Puntarella.Party nasce dall'incontro tra alcunÉ™ utenti abitanti tra Roma e il Lazio e attivÉ™ da tempo all'istanza Mastodon bolognese, mastodon.bida.im, e dalla decisione di provare a riprodurre un'esperienza simile nel territorio romano. LÉ™ compagnÉ™ di Bida, pionierÉ™ del fediverso italofono, hanno sempre invitato a dare vita a istanze locali: raccogliamo la sfida, come giÃ  avvenuto a Milano (nebbia.fail) e Torino (mastodon.cisti.org). Il collettivo si fonda su meccanismi di fiducia e di conoscenza diretta e non solo virtuale; ha l'onere del mantenimento dell'infrastruttura tecnica e della moderazione dei contenuti secondo la policy

PER CHI

Puntarella.party si rivolge a tutte e tutti coloro che ambiscono alla trasformazione dell'esistente in direzione di una piena giustizia sociale, agli spazi sociali, ai collettivi, alle esperienze di attivismo, per offirire uno strumento di informazione, confronto, discussione alternativo alle grandi piattaforme commerciali. Per iscriversi all'istanza Ã¨ necessario l'invio di qualche breve riga di presentazione.

COME

Le interazioni sull'istanza sono regolate da una policy, la cui prima stesura Ã¨ stata decisa dal collettivo sulla base della visione della realtÃ  condivisa tra É™ suÉ™ componenti e sulla base dell'esperienza pregressa sulle istanze Mastodon italofone. La policy puÃ² essere emendata tramite applicazione del metodo del consenso da assemblee di istanza da tenersi in presenza e che (appena sarÃ  possibile) verranno convocate con regolaritÃ . Oltre a seguire le indicazioni della policy perchÃ© l'esperimento funzioni e sia durevole Ã¨ indispensabile che ogni utente si impegni a interagire in modo costruttivo, rispettoso, non competitivo, a non fare dell'istanza uno sfogatoio di dissidi nati al suo esterno. La qualitÃ  delle interazioni all'interno di una comunitÃ  del fediverso, per quanto finora osservato, dipende molto piÃ¹ dalla capacitÃ  che essa ha di autodeterminarsi che dal disegno della piattaforma su cui queste interazioni hanno luogo: per questo Puntarella.Party non adotterÃ  la prassi di orientare il comportamento dell'utenza intervenendo tecnicamente sul software, limitandone o eliminandone funzioni. La prioritÃ  Ã¨ la diffusione di contenuti di informazione e di analisi, ma un social network ha anche bisogno della sua quota di frivolezze e gattini.

Roma, aprile 2021
Collettivo Puntarella

LA POLICY: COSA SI PUÃ’ FARE, COSA NO

1. COSA NON SI PUÃ’ PUBBLICARE

  • contenuti razzisti, sessisti, omotransfobici, fascisti, discriminatori, militaristi
  • messaggi di propaganda elettorale e di partito, istituzionale, e nazionalista. Non saranno accettati account di partiti politici; non Ã¨ escluso a priori che un account personale possa pubblicizzare iniziative, manifestazioni o analisi riconducibili a partiti politici, ci si appella all'autoregolamentazione dei singoli; nei due mesi precedenti un appuntamento elettorale la moderazione potrebbe essere piÃ¹ stringente
  • messaggi finalizzati esclusivamente alla promozione di attivitÃ  commerciali
  • minacce, insulti, messaggi denigratori nei confronti di altrÉ™ utente del fediverso
  • link diretti a social network commerciali (facebook, instagram, twitter, tiktok); nessun divieto, invece, per telegram, reddit e piattaforme di streaming audio e video
  • contenuti negazionisti di fatti storicamente o scientificamente accertati, teorie di acclarata natura cospirazionista. Salvo casi estremi si tenderÃ  a privilegiare il confronto alla moderazione, da esercitare con elasticitÃ 
  • contenuti che invitino a commettere fatti di sangue o ne costituiscano celebrazione
  • dati personali e sensibili. In particolare non Ã¨ ammesso rivelare l'identitÃ  dellÉ™ altrÉ™ utenti

Il collettivo si riserva comunque di chiedere la rimozione o rimuovere direttamente qualsiasi contenuto possa essere lesivo per il collettivo stesso o per lÉ™ altrÉ™ utenti

1.b COSA METTERE SOTTO "CONTENT WARNING"

(cosa vuol dire?)

  • nudo, erotismo, pornografia (usare anche #nsfw - cos'Ã¨?)
  • immagini di violenza
  • contenuti splatter / gore
  • contenuti che altri utenti hanno giÃ  segnalato come fonte di disagio

2. SOFFERENZA PSICOLOGICA

Qualora sull'istanza unÉ™ utente esprimano situazioni di sofferenza psicologica e/o possibili azioni auto/etero lesive e/o suicidarie, la comunitÃ  si impegna ad interagire con l'utente, attivando risposte di ascolto e/o sostegno, cercando di individuare/attivare account amicÉ™ o possibili conoscenti e/o reti di mutuo aiuto sul territorio qualora la posizione dell'utente sia nota alla comunitÃ ."

3. INTIMITÃ€ VIOLATE

Nel caso di contenuti #nsfw a sfondo erotico/sessuale di provenienza dubbia, gli/le admin possono chiedere di contestualizzare l'origine di tali contenuti. Con "provenienza dubbia" intendiamo casi in cui non sia chiaro il consenso delle persone ritratte, cioÃ¨ possibili casi di revenge porn, intimitÃ¡ violate etc. Gli utenti che postano questo tipo di contenuti sono immediatamente silenziati fino all'avvenuto chiarimento.

4. BOT

Chi gestisce un bot (account gestito da un software) dovrÃ  inserire nel profilo del bot un account mastodon reperibile a cui contattarlo, o quantomeno rispondere tramite il bot stesso. Diversamente, gli/le admin si riservano di cancellare il bot. Tutti i punti del manifesto si applicano anche ai bot. I bot automatici (per esempio: bot di gif, di giochi di parole, di emoji...) possono postare una volta ogni 5 ore. I bot collegati a feed rss/atom possono pubblicare indicativamente fino a 10 toot al giorno. Resta possibile concordare una frequenza diversa per bot che non pubblicano sulla timeline locale (contattare gli/le admin per richieste specifiche).

5. FLOOD

Non si puÃ³ intasare la timeline locale con toot ripetuti e/o in stretta successione (cosiddetto "flood"). Non ci sono limiti specifici per gli account "umani", gli/le admin valutano le segnalazioni della comunitÃ . Il live-tooting di manifestazioni, assemblee, iniziative sociali autogestite non Ã¨ mai considerato flood.

6. LINGUE

Lingue accettate:

  • italiano
  • inglese
  • spagnolo
  • francese
  • polacco
    • per ragioni di moderazione

    7. DATI

    I contenuti di questa istanza non possono essere usati per fini di ricerca o machine learning senza l'esplicito consenso degli utenti coinvolti I contenuti di istanza non possono essere archiviati o indicizzati in blocco da nessun utente o servizio. Gli utenti attivi possono esportare la loro lista di follower e il contenuto dei propri post tramite l'interfaccia web.

    PUNTARELLA.PARTY'S MANIFESTO

    WHAT

    Puntarella.party is an independent social network, free from profit logic, not regulated by any algorithm, anti-fascist, anti-racist and anti-sexist, based in Rome. More precisely, it is a node (instance) of a network of hundreds of other independent servers around the world (Fediverse) and it adopts a microblogging software (what does that mean?): Mastodon. How does Mastodon work? There is an excellent guide on (an excellent guide is available at) mastodon.help. We only need to add that here a post (toot) can be up to 840 characters long.

    WHO

    The collective managing Puntarella.Party was born when some Mastodon users living between Rome and Lazio and active in the Bologna Mastodon instance - mastodon.bida.im - met in person, and decided to try to reproduce a similar experience in the Roman territory. The comrades from Bida, pioneers of the italophone Fediverse, have always called for the creation of local instances: we took up the challenge, as it has already happened in Milan (nebbia.fail) and Turin (mastodon.cisti.org). The collective is based on mechanisms of trust and in real life meetings, not just virtual; it is responsible for maintaining the technical infrastructure and moderating the content according to the policy

    FOR WHOM

    Puntarella.party is a place for all those who aspire to the transformation of the existing in the direction of full social justice, for social spaces, collectives, activist experiences, in order to offer a tool for information, confrontation, discussion, as an alternative to big commercial platforms. To sign up to the instance, please send a few lines of presentation.

    HOW TO

    Interactions on the instance are regulated by a policy, the first draft of which was decided by the collective on the basis of a vision of reality shared by its members and on the basis of previous experiences on the Italian-speaking Mastodon instances. The policy can be amended through the application of consensus decision-making by (an instance assembly) instance assemblies to be held in person and which (as soon as possible) will be convened on a regular basis. In addition to following the indications of the policy, in order for the experiment to work and be long-lasting, it is crucial that each user undertakes to interact in a constructive, respectful, non-competitive manner, and not to make the instance a venting ground for disagreements originating outside it. The quality of interactions within a community of the fediverse, as far as has been observed up to now, depends much more on its capacity to self-determine itself than on the design of the platform on which these interactions take place: this is why Puntarella.Party will not adopt the practice of directing user behaviour by technically intervening in the software, limiting or eliminating functions. The priority is the dissemination of information and analysis, but a social network also needs its share of frivolities and kittens.

    THE POLICY: WHAT YOU CAN DO, WHAT YOU CANNOT DO

    1. WHAT YOU CANNOT PUBLISH

  • racist, sexist, homophobic, fascist, discriminatory, militarist content

  • electoral, party, institutional, and nationalist propaganda messages. Political party accounts will not be accepted; we do not exclude that a private account may publicise initiatives, events or analyses that can be traced back to political parties, we appeal to the self-regulation of individuals; in the two months preceding an election, moderation may be more stringent

  • messages aimed exclusively at promoting commercial activities

  • threats, insults, disparaging messages towards other users of the fediverse

  • direct links to commercial social networks (facebook, instagram, twitter, tiktok); no ban, however, for telegram, reddit and audio and video streaming platforms

  • content denying historically or scientifically established facts, conspiracy theories. Except in extreme cases, there will be a tendency to favour confrontation over moderation, to be exercised with flexibility

  • content that invites or celebrates acts of bloodshed

  • private and sensitive data. In particular, revealing the identity of other users is not permitted

    • The collective reserves the right to request the removal or directly remove any content that may be harmful to the collective itself or to other users.

    1.b WHAT TO PUT UNDER "CONTENT WARNING" (what does it mean?)

  • nudity, eroticism, pornography (use #nsfw - what is that?)

  • images of violence

  • splatter / gore content

  • content that other users have already reported as causing discomfort

    • 2. PSYCHOLOGICAL DISTRESS

    In the event that a user expresses situations of psychological suffering and/or possible self-/other-injury and/or suicidal intents, the community undertakes the responsibility to interact with the user, activating listening and/or support responses, trying to identify/activate friends' accounts or possible acquaintances and/or mutual aid networks in the area if the user's position is known to the community.

    3. VIOLATED INTIMACY

    In the case of erotic/sexual #nsfw content of dubious provenance, admins may ask you to contextualise the origin of such content. By 'dubious provenance' we mean cases where the consent of the persons depicted is unclear, i.e. possible cases of revenge porn, violated intimacy etc. Users who post this type of content are immediately silenced until clarification is provided.

    4. BOT

    Whoever operates a bot (account managed by a software) shall include in the bot's profile a reachable Mastodon account to which they can be contacted, or at least reply via the bot itself. Otherwise, the admins reserve the right to delete the bot. All points in the manifesto also apply to bots. Automatic bots (e.g. gif bots, pun bots, emoji bots...) may post once every 5 hours. Bots linked to rss/atom feeds can post up to 10 toots per day, approximately. It remains possible to agree on a different frequency for bots that do not publish on the local timeline (contact admins for specific requests).

    5. FLOODING

    You cannot clog the local timeline with repeated toots and/or in close succession (so-called 'flooding'). There are no specific limits for 'human' accounts, the admins assess the reports of the community. Live-tooting of events, assemblies, self-managed social initiatives is never considered flooding.

    6. LANGUAGES

    Accepted languages:

  • Italian

  • English

  • Spanish

  • French

  • Polish

    • for moderation reasons

    7. DATA

    Instance content may not be used for research or machine learning purposes without the explicit consent of the users involved. Instance content may not be archived or indexed in bulk by any user or service. Active users can export their list of followers and the content of their posts via the web interface.
Short: a/social indipendente di Roma

Description:
A general failure to follow the guidelines ("Server rules") section on the about page will, depending on the severity, lead to the removal of your posts or your account.

Welcome to CatCatNya~! We are an instance hoping to foster a diverse queer community's presence in the Fediverse, which includes, but is absolutely not limited to:

  • cats
  • queerness
  • plurality
  • disability
  • anti-racism

We are mainly speaking English and German, but other languages are also welcome.

Basically, the only things we exclude is fascists and tankies. We do not like those. Authoritarianism is garbage because it is detrimental to what's mentioned above. Yes, even cats. Have you ever seen a cat like authority?

Unfortunately, some authority is required to do moderation and even to host an instance to begin with.

We are meowderated by:

  • @kescher - Foundnya, Hostnya, Nyadmin and Meowderator
  • @sk - Nyadmin and Meowderator

We have additional subdomains for multi-account access in separate browser tabs:

  • 0.catcatnya.com
  • 1.catcatnya.com
  • 2.catcatnya.com
  • 3.catcatnya.com
  • 4.catcatnya.com
  • 5.catcatnya.com
  • 6.catcatnya.com
  • 7.catcatnya.com
  • 8.catcatnya.com
  • 9.catcatnya.com

We offer SSO integration with some services: - git.kescher.at, a Forgejo instance - git.gay, another Forgejo instance

Federation policy

CatCatNya~ will generally freely federate, however, meowderation is strict. Defederation will occur if harassment occurs, fash/tankies are on the overwhelming majority on an instance, an instance being "free speech", or if an instance is otherwise deemed an immediate danger to users on CatCatNya~. If an instance does not pose an active threat to its users, but is deemed unmeowderated, it will likely result in a limit. Actions done by remote nyadmins/meowderators are weighed more heavily than individual users.

If your instance uses the UFoI, it will likely be suspended, since the very nature of the UFoI is a malicious pact founded by the admin of qoto.org to stop folks from defederating from them.

If your instance welcomes cops, it will at the very least be limited, but we may suspend.

While our set of guidelines already states that anything illegal in Austria will be blocked, we feel it is neccessary to highlight that we suspend any instances promoting child sex abuse ("MAPs" and other euphemisms for pedophilia) and zoophilia once we notice them.

If your instance runs a really old version of a Fedi software and it causes processing issues at our end, your instance may be suspended simply because you don't keep your software up-to-date at all. You shouldn't be running Mastodon 2.5.2 anymore. No, 2.7.0 is also not going to cut it.

Other info

We are running our own fork of glitch-soc, which is also a fork of Mastodon. For more info about glitch-soc, see the glitch-soc webpage. For more info about our own fork see this git repository.

In response to the poor performance of big instances like mastodon.social and mastodon.online, we are implementing the following simple policy: Once we reach around 200 monthly active users, we will disable registrations. We are strongly opposed to the existence of big instances of software for a decentralized protocol.

This instance is hosted on the same machine as an Arch mirror. Therefore, the network performance on this instance may vary. This should not be a real issue, considering these server specs:

  • 14 dedicated cores of an AMD EPYCâ„¢ 7702 CPU
  • 64 GiB of DDR4 ECC RAM
  • Storage:
    • 2 TiB of NVMe storage
    • Continually scaled, remote, encrypted media storage, partially cached on NVMe above
  • Hosted in Vienna, Austria
  • Network bandwidth of 2.5 Gbps, symmetric
  • Running on , btw
  • Hourly encrypted backups to a large backup host

Donate to our moderation team:

Donation links for hosting this instance, more info about the Ownya and more at kescher.at.

rip notbird.site :(

Emoji Attributions

  • Blobhaj by Heatherhorns, Version December 13th 2023
  • Queer Butterfly Emojis + More Pride Butterflies! by FrazzledBrynn
  • Neofox by Volpeon, Version 1.3
  • Neocat by Volpeon, Version 1.1
Short: We are CatCatNya~, a left-wing instance by cats, for cats (and more!)
