Description:
Welcome to Techtoots:

An english Mastodon community focused around tech (any vintage!). We welcome technologists, coders, engineers, gadget lovers, self professed â€œgeeksâ€ and anyone with an interest and love of tech. If you share the opinion that the the best technologies are the ones that most resemble â€˜magicâ€™- youâ€™ve found your home in the fediverse!

Social networking, back in your hands!

Sharing your thoughts has never been more convenient. Publish anything you want: links, pictures, text, video. All on a platform that is community-owned and ad-free.

You have 500 characters. You can adjust the thumbnails of your pictures with focal points. You can use custom emojis, hide things behind spoiler warnings and choose who sees a given post. Messed it up? You can delete & redraft for quick corrections.

Without an incentive to sell you things, Mastodon allows you to consume content you enjoy uninterrupted. Your feed is chronological, ad-free and non-algorithmicâ€”you decide who you want to see!

Be sure to check our Terms & Code of Conduct.

Support the Community

Since we do not serve ads and we do not sell data we rely on your support. If you like you can donate to help us out a little to defray the monthly costs of operating our instance. Any support is appreciate and completely voluntary - thanks for your consideration.

Patreon

Mastodon Server Covenant Commitment

We're committed to the Mastodon server covenant which includes the following:

  • Active moderation against racism, sexism, homophobia and transphobia.
  • Daily backups of user data.
  • At least one other person with emergency access to the server infrastructure.
  • Commitment to give users at least 3 months of advance warning in case of shutting down.

You can read more information here.
Short: An english Mastodon community focused around technology (any vintage!). We welcome technologists, coders, engineers, gadget lovers, self professed â€œgeeksâ€ and anyone with an interest and love of tech.

Description:
Pixelfed is an image sharing platform, an ethical alternative to centralized platforms.
Babb.no is a instance dedicated mostly to Norwegian users, specially those connected to the University of Oslo, but join us if you want even if you don't fall into our target group.
Short: Babb.no is a Norwegian instance of Pixelfed, an image sharing platform where you are in control of your data.

Description:
A comfy, non-toxic, and inclusive Misskey/Sharkey Server for Anime/Manga/Japanese Media fans and Anime/Japanese Media Content Creators (Bloggers/Video Creators/Podcasters/etc.). Sister instance of sakurajima.moe.

Note: You may not use TOR and/or Temporary/Burner Email to create an account. (TOR can be used after creating an account).
Short:
A comfy, non-toxic, and inclusive Misskey/Sharkey Server for Anime/Manga/Japanese Media fans and Anime/Japanese Media Content Creators (Bloggers/Video Creators/Podcasters/etc.). Sister instance of sakurajima.moe.

Note: You may not use TOR and/or Temporary/Burner Email to create an account. (TOR can be used after creating an account).

Description:
Welcome to The Company of Biologists' server on Mastodon. This is a space for biologists to discuss science, research, teaching, life, and more. We would like to build a community and support communication between biologists. This doesn't always involve scientific discussion, so feel free to go off-topic and have fun.

Who's behind this?

The server is hosted by The Company of Biologists. We are a not-for-profit publishing organisation dedicated to supporting and inspiring the biological community. In addition to publishing five peer-reviewed journals â€” Development, Journal of Cell Science, Journal of Experimental Biology, Disease Models & Mechanism and Biology Open â€” we host a number of community sites that help people connect and share resources. We have a keen interest in supporting early-career researchers and promoting sustainability in science.

General info

The Company of Biologists operates this instance in support of the biological community, with a particular focus on developmental biology, cell biology, microscopy, and comparative physiology. The instance is intended primarily for those working in, or with a keen interest in, biology and related fields.

Users are responsible for their own content. If you have questions or reports about the content, please contact mastodon@biologists.com. Please note that The Company of Biologists does not guarantee the high availability of the instance.

Code of conduct

Be excellent to each other and respect the rules.

Keep in mind that our server's aim is community building and sharing of information, ideas, and interests in respect of each other.

The following guidelines are not a legal document, and the final interpretation is up to the serverâ€™s administrators; they are here to provide you with an insight into our content moderation policies. The following types of content are not allowed: any content and activity that is illegal in the UK or the EU; nudity, pornography, and sexually explicit content, including artistic depictions; hate speech, racism, sexism, homophobia, transphobia, ableism, fatmisia, xenophobia and/or violent nationalism, or the advocation of all of the above; threats of physical violence against any person, animal, or institution; gore and graphic violence; spam (no flooding the public timeline with excessive automated posts); uncurated bots posting from third-party sources, e.g. news.

Also, any conduct intended to stalk or harass other users, impede other users from utilising the service, degrade the performance of the service, harass other users, or incite other users to perform any of the actions above, is disallowed.

These provisions notwithstanding, the administration of the service reserves the right to revoke any user's access permissions, at any time, for any reason, except as limited by law.

Reporting harassment

To report harassment, please send an email to mastodon@biologists.com. If you believe anyone is in physical danger or doing something against the law, please notify appropriate emergency services first by calling the relevant local authorities.

Policies

Your continued use of this server implies your agreement with our policies. If you disagree with our policies, please discontinue the use of our services. For further details about how we manage the data related to this server, please refer to our privacy policy.
Short: Run by The Company of Biologists, this is a space for biologists to discuss science, research, teaching, life, and more. We would like to build a community and support communication between biologists

Description:
Denden.world is a queer, furry, pokefur and therian friendly fediverse space.

This instance is run by @kiophen to provide a den in the fediverse with minimal defederation.

Forums: https://forums.den.nohost.me/

CODE OF CONDUCT

You have to follow the rules to use this instance. I don't want to get our instance suspended by other instances and want this to be a pleasant place to be. Please follow our rules and try to be courteous to the fediverse culture in public posts. The rules are available in the "server rules" tab below.

Explicit pornographic content must use a Content Warning, but the extent that you use other CWs is up to you. It is encouraged to CW common topics that bother people when posting on Public. Public posts will show up to people who do not follow you on the federated/local timelines, so be courteous.

Unlisted posts will show up for non-followers if someone reblogs your post, but I think that should be up to the sharer to decide if they want to share an non-CW'd post to their followers. * Please note that people can see unlisted posts if they visit your profile.

Followers-Only posts are only visible to logged-in followers and cannot be reblogged. It's up to you if you want to CW these, only your followers will be able to see them.

FEDERATION POLICY

Denden will blacklist instances that foster hate-speech, harassment, CSAM (child sex abuse material), or anything else that is illegal to host in the United States.

Denden does not use pre-made instance blocklists. There have been too many occasions of blocklists being manipulated by bad actors to include innocent people for me to trust them. Blocked instances are individually vetted by the admins.

We will not blacklist instances based on 'guilt-by-federation': if an instance federates with a "bad" instance, but otherwise does not foster bad behavior (racism/harassment/etc), it will not be blacklisted.

We will also not blacklist an instance solely based on disputes with admins. The actions of admins do not necessarily represent the views of regular users on the instance.

Denden's rules are designed to both foster a pleasant community as well as minimize the likelihood of being blacklisted by other instances. The content mentioned in rule 4 is illegal in France, where many instances are hosted.

INFO FOR DENDEN USERS

Other instances won't be suspended unless they foster hate-speech, harassment, or CSAM. You might see content that you don't like in the federated timeline. Make sure to set filters in your account settings.

Instead of us suspending instances, I encourage you to curate your own instance blocklist. You can block an instance in the same way you can block a user, you will not see anything from the whole instance, and users in that instance will not be able to interact with you.

In the event I need to take the server down for good, I will give everyone at least 3 months notice to export your data and migrate to another server.

MODERATION

If someone is being troublesome, please report them. If they're from another instance, I am able to block them from this instance.

Please only forward reports to a rule-breaker's instance if they are breaking the rules on their instance as well. You are anonymous to other instance's admins in forwarded reports.

NOTE TO OTHER ADMINS

If you have an issue with our rules or user's behavior, I would greatly appreciate letting me know at @kiophen before defederating. I'm open to listen and try to resolve problems.

SYSTEM INFO

Donations are greatly appreciated and help keep the server up. https://ko-fi.com/kiophen

Running a customized version of glitchsoc on a home server rack since July 9, 2023

Full daily backups

All custom assets in the site theme made by kiophen

Previously den.den.nohost.me
Short: A queer and kink-friendly den for creatures and furries. 18+ only.

Description:
ğŸŒ Join planetearth.social: A Growing Community for Earth Lovers and Beyond! ğŸŒ¿

Are you passionate about our beautiful planet and eager to connect with like-minded individuals who share your love for Mother Earth? We invite you to be part of something special! Welcome to planetearth.social, a new and blossoming Mastodon server dedicated to fostering sustainability, environmental consciousness, and diverse discussions.

As a new server, we are excited to build a thriving community from the ground up, and we need your unique voice to help us grow. By joining planetearth.social, you'll have the opportunity to shape the conversations, forge new connections, and make a meaningful impact within our close-knit community.

Here's why you should join us:

ğŸŒ± Be a Founding Member: As an early adopter, you'll have the chance to be part of our server's foundation. Share your ideas, suggestions, and interests as we shape the direction and culture of our growing community together. Your voice truly matters!

ğŸŒ¿ Engage in Meaningful Discussions: With a smaller, close-knit community, you'll have a greater opportunity to engage in deeper and more personal conversations. Share your thoughts on sustainability, discover new perspectives, and explore a wide range of topics that interest you. Your contributions will be valued and appreciated.

ğŸŒ Connect with Like-Minded Individuals: By joining planetearth.social, you'll connect with a group of passionate individuals who share your love for our planet. Exchange ideas, experiences, and insights with fellow Earth enthusiasts who are just as eager as you to make a positive impact. Forge lasting connections with like-minded souls.

ğŸŒ Shape the Future Together: Help us create a community that reflects our shared values and aspirations. By actively participating and inviting others to join, you contribute to the growth and vibrancy of planetearth.social. Together, we can create a supportive and empowering space that inspires positive change.

ğŸŒ» Explore New Horizons: As our community grows, you'll have the opportunity to discover diverse perspectives and engage in conversations that expand your knowledge and worldview. From sustainability to various other interests, the possibilities for exploration and learning are endless.

Join us at planetearth.social today and be part of a vibrant and growing community that celebrates our planet and embraces a wide range of topics. Together, let's shape a future where sustainability and diverse discussions thrive. We may be new, but with your presence, we can build something extraordinary!

ğŸ‘‰ Sign up now at planetearth.social and be a part of our journey from the very beginning! ğŸŒğŸŒ¿

Description:
Welcome to the BSD Cafe!

We are thrilled to have you here and hope you enjoy your stay.

We are proud to serve a variety of BSDs, including FreeBSD, NetBSD, OpenBSD, and DragonflyBSD, as well as welcoming those who prefer Linux. We believe that all operating systems have something to offer and we strive to create a respectful and inclusive community.

We ask that you please be polite and considerate of others while you are here. We do not tolerate harmful or offensive behavior and we encourage constructive discussions and interactions. Remember, we are all here to learn and grow together, not to tear each other down.

You can access more information about this instance and other services offered by the BSD Cafe by visiting our wiki at: https://wiki.bsd.cafe/

If you want to, you can offer a Coffe at BSD Cafe. By supporting BSD Cafe, you're not just contributing to a platform; you're nurturing a vibrant community. Your generosity helps us sustain and enhance our services, ensuring that BSD enthusiasts worldwide have a welcoming and supportive home. The link is https://ko-fi.com/bsdcafe (Ko-fi) or https://liberapay.com/bsdcafe (Liberapay)

Thank you for joining us at the BSD Cafe. We hope you have a great experience here!
Short: Welcome to the BSD Cafe! We're excited to serve you the best flavors of BSD, including FreeBSD, NetBSD, OpenBSD, and DragonflyBSD. But if you prefer Linux, you're welcome here too!

I started this server because I was tired of getting banned from the major platforms like Twitter and Instagram and having to start over.

As long as it's legal, you're welcome to post what you like.

Description: This is a Pixelfed instance with the goal of bringing the Gear, Kink and LGBTIQ+ Community together. Providing a Home for all the people being forced away from big cooperate operated social-media site like Instagram, BlueSky or Twitter. This shall combine the advantages of being connected via the Fediverse but also with some of the comforting features we grew familiar to on bigger platforms.
Short: Instance for sharing Gear Pictures. LGBTIQ+ and kink friendly!

Description:
Pebble.social

A kinder, safer, and more fun community!

Pebble (aka T2) set out to be a kinder, safer, more fun platform. Within this community, that mission remains our compass to steer by.

Contacting Admins

Use the group handle @pebble-admin to contact admins.

Moderation and Administration

Moderation and Administration is presently volunteer-based. Any ideas, reports, or other issues are examined case-by-case. Actions taken are oriented towards our guidelines and over-arching goal of a kinder, safer, more fun community.

If you see a snail making its rounds, that's Herbert.
Short: Why "Pebble"? A tiny stone can cause ripples across a whole pond. Just like every one of you, sharing your stories and insights, can create waves in our online community.

Description:
About TOPLAP Social

CONTENTS STILL EVOLVING

TOPLAP Social is intended as the home for live coding on Mastodon. It is for those involved with live coding in some capacity - practitioner, organizer, learner, researcher, getting started, or exploring.

Joining

If you want to participate in our live coding community, please request an account and briefly tell us about your live coding interest. If you are already engaged in live coding, one sentence is enough ("I'm currently live coding in Tidal, Hydra and Mercury.") If you are learning or curious and exploring, tell us more about what you want to do with live coding and why you want to join. If you don't mention live coding or something closely related, we will likely leave your account request in "Pending" and ask for more detail.

When you join - Profile + #introduction

Once you have your bearings please add details to your Profile and tell us about yourself with an #introduction post.

  • What platforms are you interested in exploring, or what are you already using?
  • Add info to help us get to know you, and perhaps link to some things you've made or are interested in.
  • Be sure to add an #introduction tag, and other hashtags that you expect to follow.

Goals for TOPLAP Social

We are striving for an active, engaged, supportive, diverse, and safe environment.

  • A place where live coders and those interested in live coding share their thoughts, ideas and creative expressions.
  • It must be a place free of threatening or uncomfortable speech and generally not cluttered with a lot of unrelated chatter.
  • We seek higher levels of engagement that foster communication, interaction, and vulnerability.
  • Ultimately it should be simple and down to earth - a place where people talk about their activity, interests and journeys in live coding and related creative expressions.

Moderation (MORE COMING SOON)

Monitoring and managing content will become more important as our community grows. Fortunately, Mastodon has built-in tools to help. We plan to flesh this out as soon as we can, and plan to expand our team of admins to help review and respond to posts that may diverge from our shared community interest. For now, you can post any concerns about content to the @toplap shared admin account.

Content Aids (MORE ON THIS COMING)

  • You should use Content Warnings (CW) for any post, graphic, or video that may potentially be unwanted by others.
  • Add descriptions for media content.

Community and Project Accounts

We have made a point of bringing in local community accounts and project accounts.

  • Community accounts can be existing TOPLAP nodes or any other local organization engaged in live coding activity. In this way we learn about and support activity happening at the local level.
  • Project accounts represent specific live coding languages and platforms, like Mercury, Gibber, TidalCycles or combined projects like Bubo Tools.

Using TOPLAP Social

  • Check the timelines regularly (Home, Notifications, Local, etc). The Home timeline shows activity from yourself and your Followers. The Local timeline shows activity from TOPLAP Social, all posts from all accounts on our server.
  • Respond to posts of interest - reply, boost, favorite, bookmark, etc.
  • Visibility (link icon): You can set the visibility level on your post, setting local-only vs federated for every post and reply you make. The default "Federated" is best for most posts, but circumstances exist where you want to limit something to our server alone.
  • Visibility (globe icon): Select "Public", "Followers Only", or "Mentioned People Only".
  • Annoucements: we will use these to communicate important messages to everyone.

Hometown

We run on a forked instance of mastodon called Hometown. It has a few key enhancements, including local-only posts, and an increased post limit of 1500 characters (up from 500). https://github.com/hometown-fork/hometown

Admin team

  • @highharmonics@toplap.org
  • @saraghp@post.lurk.org
  • @yaxu@post.lurk.org

We use @toplap@toplap.org as a shared administrative account.

We are actively looking for people interested to help. We need more people to help bring diverse perspectives and cover more timezones and (human) languages. We are seeking help with content moderation. As it's a brand new community, run with a flat structure by consensus, you'd have a hand in helping shape the community as it grows.

Costs / Open Collective crowd fund

For longevity of this server, we will establish an operating fund. This needs to be sustainable for the long term. The server costs are ~ $25 USD per month, which will increase to $35. With event streaming, infrastructure costs will grow to $50+/month. Our $100 referral credit has expired and we are now accruing hosting costs monthly.

The TOPLAP opencollective crowd fund is now available. People with funding sources and those with adequate means can contribute to the costs. Locations with advantageous exchange rates can also be considered.

Contributions: https://opencollective.com/toplap

More about Live Coding

Live coding is a movement in performing arts tech that began around the year 2000. TOPLAP is a loose organisation formed in 2004, to collectively explore and promote live coding.

You can read more about live coding in Live Coding: A User's Manual. Available via open access.

The aim of this server is to help host a community of live coders on the fediverse. You can find a growing list of live coding communities and project accounts (on this instance and beyond) in this post.
Short: The home of live coding. This server is intended for those involved with live coding in some capacity - practitioner, learner, researcher, or just getting started.

Description:
Pi Club Social Platform

Pi Club is a social networking platform designed specifically for Pi pioneers, enthusiasts, and contributors. Similar in concept to Twitter, Pi Club provides a dedicated space for individuals interested in cryptocurrency, blockchain technology, and the Pi Network. Users can engage in discussions, share project updates, and connect with like-minded individuals within the Pi community. With a focus on decentralization and user privacy, Pi Club aims to foster meaningful interactions and collaboration among its members. Whether you're a seasoned crypto expert or just starting your journey in the world of digital currencies, Pi Club welcomes you to join the conversation and explore the exciting possibilities of the Pi Network.

Our Goals

Our goal with Pi Club is to establish a vibrant and inclusive social networking platform tailored specifically for the Pi community. We aim to create a space where Pi pioneers, enthusiasts, and contributors can come together to engage in meaningful discussions, share insights, and collaborate on projects related to cryptocurrency and blockchain technology.

Our Vision

Through Pi Club, we aspire to foster a sense of community among our members, empowering them to connect with like-minded individuals, stay updated
Short: Pi Club is a social networking platform designed specifically for Pi pioneers, enthusiasts, and contributors.
rules: [{'id': '2', 'text': "Respect others: Maintain politeness and respect in communication, avoiding the use of offensive or provocative language. Respect others' viewpoints and positions, actively listen, and provide constructive feedback."}, {'id': '3', 'text': "Protect privacy: Uphold users' privacy rights by not sharing or disclosing others' personal information without permission, including but not limited to real names, contact information, home addresses, etc."}, {'id': '4', 'text': 'Follow the law: Strictly adhere to local laws and regulations, prohibiting the posting of any content that violates legal provisions, including but not limited to malicious defamation, insults, pornography, violence, etc.'}, {'id': '5', 'text': "Keep content relevant: Ensure that the content posted is relevant to the server's theme or discussion topics, and refrain from posting irrelevant information or spam content. Maintain the depth and meaningfulness of discussions."}, {'id': '6', 'text': "Respect intellectual property: Do not infringe upon others' intellectual property rights, including but not limited to copyrights, trademarks, patents, etc. Do not post unauthorized works of others, including text, images, audio, video, etc."}, {'id': '7', 'text': 'Follow the rules: Adhere to the rules and guidelines set by the server, including but not limited to registration terms, terms of use, etc., to ensure the orderly and stable operation of the server.'}, {'id': '8', 'text': 'Respect administrators: Respect and obey the management decisions of server administrators. If you have any questions or objections, you can raise them through appropriate channels, but do not engage in malicious behavior or violations.'}, {'id': '9', 'text': 'Foster a positive atmosphere: Share beneficial, positive, and inspiring content, encourage mutual assistance and support among users, and create a positive and friendly communication atmosphere to build a harmonious community together.'}, {'id': '10', 'text': 'Equal treatment: Treat all users equally, without discrimination or differentiation based on race, gender, sexual orientation, religious beliefs, status, etc., to establish an inclusive and open communication environment.'}]
